course_title: Special Topics: Music: Composing for Film
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course introduces histories and techniques of composing for film and video. We will analyze examples from commercial and experimental film, TV, video games, and animation. We will explore techniques for working with live orchestras and ensembles, as well as MIDI and other electronic techniques to create vivid and powerful soundtracks. We will critically engage with these techniques and our materials to ask questions about musical signification and representation, sonic stereotypes, and sonic presence through sound. This course is designed for Composition track majors, but other students with compositional experience are welcome. Prerequisite: MUS 347.  
Music majors: fulfills a composition-track elective and a music-major general elective.
